segments.pli: Saṃyutta Nikāya 12
segments.en: Linked Discourses 12

segments.pli: 7. Mahāvagga
segments.en: 7. The Great Chapter

segments.pli: 64. Atthirāgasutta
segments.en: 64. If There Is Desire

segments.pli: Sāvatthiyaṃ viharati.
segments.en: At Sāvatthī.

segments.pli: “Cattārome, bhikkhave, āhārā bhūtānaṃ vā sattānaṃ ṭhitiyā sambhavesīnaṃ vā anuggahāya.
segments.en: “Mendicants, there are these four fuels. They maintain sentient beings that have been born and help those that are about to be born.

segments.pli: Katame cattāro?
segments.en: What four?

segments.pli: Kabaḷīkāro āhāro oḷāriko vā sukhumo vā, phasso dutiyo, manosañcetanā tatiyā, viññāṇaṃ catutthaṃ.
segments.en: Solid food, whether coarse or fine; contact is the second, mental intention the third, and consciousness the fourth.

segments.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, cattāro āhārā bhūtānaṃ vā sattānaṃ ṭhitiyā sambhavesīnaṃ vā anuggahāya.
segments.en: These are the four fuels that maintain sentient beings that have been born and help those that are about to be born.

segments.pli: Kabaḷīkāre ce, bhikkhave, āhāre atthi rāgo atthi nandī atthi taṇhā, patiṭṭhitaṃ tattha viññāṇaṃ virūḷhaṃ.
segments.en: If there is desire, relishing, and craving for solid food, consciousness becomes established there and grows.

segments.pli: Yattha patiṭṭhitaṃ viññāṇaṃ virūḷhaṃ, atthi tattha nāmarūpassa avakkanti.
segments.en: Where consciousness is established and grows, name and form are conceived.

segments.pli: Yattha atthi nāmarūpassa avakkanti, atthi tattha saṅkhārānaṃ vuddhi.
segments.en: Where name and form are conceived, there is the growth of choices.

segments.pli: Yattha atthi saṅkhārānaṃ vuddhi, atthi tattha āyatiṃ punabbhavābhinibbatti.
segments.en: Where choices grow, there is rebirth into a new state of existence in the future.

segments.pli: Yattha atthi āyatiṃ punabbhavābhinibbatti, atthi tattha āyatiṃ jātijarāmaraṇaṃ.
segments.en: Where there is rebirth into a new state of existence in the future, there is rebirth, old age, and death in the future.

segments.pli: Yattha atthi āyatiṃ jātijarāmaraṇaṃ, sasokaṃ taṃ, bhikkhave, sadaraṃ saupāyāsanti vadāmi.
segments.en: Where there is rebirth, old age, and death in the future, I say this is full of sorrow, anguish, and distress.

segments.pli: Phasse ce, bhikkhave, āhāre … pe …
segments.en: If there is desire, relishing, and craving for contact as fuel …

segments.pli: manosañcetanāya ce, bhikkhave, āhāre …
segments.en: If there is desire, relishing, and craving for mental intention as fuel …

segments.pli: viññāṇe ce, bhikkhave, āhāre atthi rāgo atthi nandī atthi taṇhā, patiṭṭhitaṃ tattha viññāṇaṃ virūḷhaṃ.
segments.en: If there is desire, relishing, and craving for consciousness as fuel, consciousness becomes established there and grows.

segments.en: Where consciousness is established and grows, name and form are conceived.

segments.en: Where there is rebirth, old age, and death in the future, I say this is full of sorrow, anguish, and distress.

segments.pli: Seyyathāpi, bhikkhave, rajako vā cittakārako vā sati rajanāya vā lākhāya vā haliddiyā vā nīliyā vā mañjiṭṭhāya vā suparimaṭṭhe vā phalake bhittiyā vā dussapaṭṭe vā itthirūpaṃ vā purisarūpaṃ vā abhinimmineyya sabbaṅgapaccaṅgaṃ;
segments.en: Suppose an artist or painter had some dye, red lac, turmeric, indigo, or rose madder. And on a polished plank or a wall or a canvas they’d create the image of a woman or a man, complete in all its various parts.

segments.pli: evameva kho, bhikkhave, kabaḷīkāre ce āhāre atthi rāgo atthi nandī atthi taṇhā, patiṭṭhitaṃ tattha viññāṇaṃ virūḷhaṃ.
segments.en: In the same way, if there is desire, relishing, and craving for solid food, consciousness becomes established there and grows.

segments.pli: Yattha patiṭṭhitaṃ viññāṇaṃ virūḷhaṃ, atthi tattha nāmarūpassa avakkanti.
segments.en: Where consciousness is established and grows, name and form are conceived.

segments.pli: Yattha atthi nāmarūpassa avakkanti, atthi tattha saṅkhārānaṃ vuddhi.
segments.en: Where name and form are conceived, there is the growth of choices.

segments.en: Where choices grow, there is rebirth into a new state of existence in the future.

segments.en: Where there is rebirth, old age, and death in the future, I say this is full of sorrow, anguish, and distress.

segments.en: If there is desire, relishing, and craving for consciousness as fuel, consciousness becomes established there and grows.

segments.en: Where consciousness is established and grows, name and form are conceived.

segments.en: Where there is rebirth, old age, and death in the future, I say this is full of sorrow, anguish, and distress.

segments.pli: Kabaḷīkāre ce, bhikkhave, āhāre natthi rāgo natthi nandī natthi taṇhā, appatiṭṭhitaṃ tattha viññāṇaṃ avirūḷhaṃ.
segments.en: If there is no desire, relishing, and craving for solid food, consciousness does not become established there and doesn’t grow.

segments.pli: Yattha appatiṭṭhitaṃ viññāṇaṃ avirūḷhaṃ, natthi tattha nāmarūpassa avakkanti.
segments.en: Where consciousness is not established and doesn’t grow, name and form are not conceived.

segments.pli: Yattha natthi nāmarūpassa avakkanti, natthi tattha saṅkhārānaṃ vuddhi.
segments.en: Where name and form are not conceived, there is no growth of choices.

segments.pli: Yattha natthi saṅkhārānaṃ vuddhi, natthi tattha āyatiṃ punabbhavābhinibbatti.
segments.en: Where choices don’t grow, there is no rebirth into a new state of existence in the future.

segments.en: Where there is no rebirth into a new state of existence in the future, there is no rebirth, old age, and death in the future.

segments.pli: Seyyathāpi, bhikkhave, kūṭāgāraṃ vā kūṭāgārasālaṃ vā uttarāya vā dakkhiṇāya vā pācīnāya vā vātapānā sūriye uggacchante vātapānena rasmi pavisitvā kvāssa patiṭṭhitā”ti?
segments.en: Suppose there was a bungalow or a hall with a peaked roof, with windows on the northern, southern, or eastern side. When the sun rises and a ray of light enters through a window, where would it land?”

segments.pli: “Pacchimāyaṃ, bhante, bhittiyan”ti.
segments.en: “On the western wall, sir.”

segments.pli: “Pacchimā ce, bhikkhave, bhitti nāssa kvāssa patiṭṭhitā”ti?
segments.en: “If there was no western wall, where would it land?”

segments.pli: “Pathaviyaṃ, bhante”ti.
segments.en: “On the ground, sir.”

segments.pli: “Pathavī ce, bhikkhave, nāssa kvāssa patiṭṭhitā”ti?
segments.en: “If there was no ground, where would it land?”

segments.pli: “Āpasmiṃ, bhante”ti.
segments.en: “In water, sir.”

segments.pli: “Āpo ce, bhikkhave, nāssa kvāssa patiṭṭhitā”ti?
segments.en: “If there was no water, where would it land?”

segments.pli: “Appatiṭṭhitā, bhante”ti.
segments.en: “It wouldn’t land, sir.”

segments.pli: “Evameva kho, bhikkhave, kabaḷīkāre ce āhāre natthi rāgo natthi nandī natthi taṇhā … pe ….
segments.en: “In the same way, if there is no desire, relishing, and craving for solid food, consciousness does not become established there and doesn’t grow. …

segments.pli: Catutthaṃ.

suttaplex.blurb: The Buddha defines the four kinds of “food” or “nutriment”, which include edible food, contact, intention, and consciousness, showing how they lead to suffering according to dependent origination.
